name: Cybersecurity
description: Policy protecting users from attempts to gather sensitive information or engage in unauthorized access through deceptive or invasive methods.
corePrinciple: Safety includes security of personal information, accounts, profiles and platform entities. Do not allow attempts to gather sensitive user information or engage in unauthorized access through platform abuse.

categories.name: Unauthorized Account & Data Access
categories.description: Attempts to access accounts or obtain sensitive information without permission

subcategories.name: Phishing
subcategories.definition: Creating communications or websites designed to look like trusted/reputable sources to fraudulently acquire sensitive user information

signals.condition: Screenshot shows login page for Meta Family of Apps
requirements: Domain is NOT legitimate Meta URL
Content promises destination but redirects to unrelated site
Text notifies about restriction, violation, account block, or security issue
Text speaks in voice of Meta platforms
Asks user to take action through offsite link
Link does NOT contain legitimate Meta URL

examples: Fake login page mimicking Facebook on non-Facebook domain
Message claiming account violation with link to fake Meta support
URL showing gmail.com but redirecting to different site
notViolating: Content not referencing Meta product in landing page
Sharing others' login info (= Publicly Sharing Login Information)
Fake play buttons to get user to follow link (= Deceptive Links)

subcategories.name: Social Engineering
subcategories.definition: Manipulating users to give away credentials or sensitive information, including repeated attempts to harvest answers to common recovery questions
signals: Manipulating user to give login credentials under false promises
Attempting to gather sensitive user information (passwords, usernames)
Repeatedly asking common security questions (2+ times by same poster)
commonSecurityQuestions: What is your mother's/grandmother's maiden name?
What was the make and model of your first car?
What are your favorite pizza toppings?
Where did you go to Elementary/Middle school?
subcategories.note: Single question in isolation is NOT violating - must be repeated or consistent
examples: Give me your FB account id, password and recovery code and I'll lift the block
Everyone share their mothers maiden name (posted repeatedly in groups)
Where did everyone go to high school? (harvesting pattern)

subcategories.name: Publicly Sharing Login Information
subcategories.definition: Sharing others' login information on platform or via linked third-party service
signals: Explicitly sharing other users' account and login information
URL claimed to include account and login information of others
examples: Here is the list of most recently leaked account names and passwords on Instagram
Click on the link to access Facebook verified accounts login details: xyz123.com

subcategories.name: Threatening, Supporting, or Admitting to Hacking
subcategories.definition: Activities related to malicious hacking threats, offers, or admissions
includes: Threatening, offering/requesting or admitting to hack accounts (Facebook, WhatsApp, Email)
Web defacements and denial of service attacks
Offering services to access unauthorized data (phone/laptop camera, criminal/university records)
Giving instructions/tutorials on how to hack

categories.name: Malicious & Harmful Code
categories.description: Attempts to share, develop, host, or distribute malicious or harmful code

subcategories.name: Malware
subcategories.definition: Malicious programs designed to harm or gain unauthorized access to systems, including ransomware

subcategories.name: Greyware
subcategories.definition: Software which detracts from hardware/software use and may be difficult to remove

subcategories.name: Spyware
subcategories.definition: Code that collects data on users and sends to third parties without consent or uses for illicit purposes (sextortion, blackmail)

subcategories.name: Automatic Download
subcategories.definition: Links causing automatic download upon opening landing page
signals: Automatic download triggered when URL clicked
Google Drive link includes 'download&id' in URL
Crawler screenshot shows indication of downloaded file

subcategories.name: Circumventing Security Systems
subcategories.definition: Software or products enabling people to circumvent security systems, hack software, passwords, or credentials
signals: Promotes software/products enabling hacking of accounts or unauthorized access
Text includes: spy, hack, clone, monitoring, location tracker
Phrase: 'installation on other device not required'
Depicts secretly gaining access to mobile device/app/location without permission
Promotes hacking training courses including 'ethical hacking'
notViolating: Page/profile has 'hack' or 'spy' in title but content doesn't offer services
examples: Click here to learn how to hack a Facebook account
I have software to spy on WhatsApp accounts
With the help of this app, you can become a master hacker

subcategories.name: Disrupting Communication or Signal Sharing
subcategories.definition: Software or products designed to disrupt communication, including jammer and descrambling devices
signals: Promotes jammers or devices to disrupt communication
Devices intercepting connection between phone and mobile base station
examples: Cell phone jammers on sale! Buy one to block your target's phone calls

subcategories.name: Malicious Infrastructure
subcategories.definition: Providing online infrastructure enabling abusive links violating Community Standards
subcategories.condition: Majority of links violate Spam or Cybersecurity sections

sensitiveUserInformation.definition: Information requiring protection from unauthorized access
types: Social Security or Government ID information
Other PII as described in Privacy Violations

loginInformation.definition: Email, username and password combinations for any app or service, whether or not associated with Meta platform

condemnation.description: Re-sharing of violating content for purpose of condemnation
condemnation.exception: If functional violating links present, still violating (risk of harm)

urlReviewProcess: Review content including URLs - assess validity
Check available screenshots from Crawler for landing page
If authorized to click URL, review landing page information for additional signals
If unauthorized to go off-platform, make decision based on SRT content
Label appropriate violation in UDT and close job

conditions: Screenshot shows login page for Meta Family of Apps (Facebook, Instagram, Threads, WhatsApp, Messenger)
User is required to enter password
Domain is NOT legitimate Meta URL
Content promises destination but redirects to unrelated site
Text notifies about restriction, violation, account block, or security issue
Text speaks in voice of Meta platforms (Meta does not notify through messenger or posts/comments)
Asks user to take action through offsite link
Link does NOT contain legitimate Meta URL

doNotTag: Content not referencing Meta product in landing page
Sharing others' login info (= Publicly Sharing Login Information)
Fake play buttons to get user to follow link (= Deceptive Links > Deceptive Platform Functionality)

conditions: Promotes software/products enabling hacking accounts or unauthorized access
Text includes: spy, hack, clone, monitoring, location tracker
Phrase: 'installation on other device not required'
Depicts secretly gaining access to device/app/location without permission
Promotes hacking training courses including 'ethical hacking'
circumventingSecurityDecisionTree.action: Label for Cybersecurity > Circumventing Security Systems
doNotTag: Page/profile has 'hack' or 'spy' in title but content doesn't offer services

conditions: Automatic download triggered when URL clicked
URL ends in file extension (.exe, .zip, .doc, .pdf, .apk, etc.)
Google Drive link includes 'download&id' in URL
Crawler screenshot shows indication of downloaded file
automaticDownloadDecisionTree.ifUnableToVerify: Check crawler screenshot for download indication, otherwise consider benign

glossary.phishing: Creating communications/websites designed to look like trusted sources to fraudulently acquire sensitive information
glossary.malware: Malicious programs designed to harm or gain unauthorized access to systems, including ransomware
glossary.spyware: Code collecting data on users and sending to third parties without consent or for illicit purposes
glossary.greyware: Software detracting from hardware/software use, difficult to remove
glossary.social_engineering: Manipulating users to give away credentials through deception or repeated harvesting attempts
glossary.sensitive_user_information: Usernames, emails, passwords, security question answers, financial data, government IDs, PII
glossary.login_information: Email, username and password combinations for any app or service
